commit message: Added Brno Dev Conference 2013.

Added Linuxtag (long ago, forgot to commit) and a Hungarian Free Software
conference.
Added OHM2013 schedule.
Added 30C3.
Added mini-DebConf in Barcelona.

LinuxTag 2014, as requested by Stefan Neufeind. Currently 403s but I hope
that'll get resolved in time.
Three 'recent' menu additions.
YAPC
Added LibreOffice Conference 2014.
Added CCC and FOSDEM 2014-'15.
Added TUEBIX 2015.
Added 'Pi and More' conference.
Add FrOSCon 2015, also purge a lot of old stuff.
CCCamp 2015.
DebConf 15
PyConES 2015

FOSDEM 2016 \o/
Also, 32C2 which I never committed apparently.
I *think* this copies all the changes to make this an IntelliJ project.
Add .idea/ which will hopefully make this stuff work..

Undo that rename. Try one more thing. I just want to code without having
to figure out which silly XML file I broke.

Well let's see whether this works. This is .bzr* and some other stuff
copied into what the auto-migration produced.

Fix bug that made the options menu invisible when loading a certain
schedule for the first time in a session.
More logo DPI. \o/
Update ignore file.

Swipe down to refresh in the chooser. This means I'm now importing the
support library, which in turn means I'm now using ProGuard (but without
obfuscation because that's just pointless).

And now, with just a settings menu item, show that in the action bar
which gets rid of the menu altogether. \o/
Padding fix in EventDialog (and noop tab fix).
Minor menu.json purge.

Times have changed, people have proper TLS certs now. Change the TLS
cert strictness default.

Replace fixed EditText widget at bottom of ChooserActivity with an add
button.
Consistent naming of translation files.
Don't need those icons anymore, refresh is now done with pulldown.

Up API level a little more. Let's try to do this material design thing. Partial
commit of a chaotic work in progress.

Very chaotic and unfinished but let's commit something at least..

In short: nav drawer, can nearly kill the option menu everywhere. Also,
flashy colours and a nicer event dialog. Still lots to do to be consistent,
this is still quite hacky and likely won't work well with 'older' phones yet.
Some more tweaking of event_dialog.
Out with the option menu, I think now everywhere. Nav drawer it is.
Smaller ic_menu icon that looks much less ugly.
Menu style update + bugfix (don't always show day change option).
At last managed to get the action bar text colour to be white. \o/
More event dialog tweaks.

Very basic HTML handling in event description. Trying to avoid using
WebView though maybe I'll end up doing that.
Ditch the bold in room + time in event dialog.

Wrap nav drawer menu in a ScrollView for tiny screens in landscape mode
for example.

Idea that needs working out: Custom links in the nav drawer, so
conferences can add links to a map, their info booklet or just website.
Right now just hardcoded and horrible. Apologies for committing. :-P

Minor navbar tweaks. Looking decent now, should maybe just pick a
different tint of grey.
Saner defaults for block schedule sizes. It was about time..

Only update drop shadows on API 21+. Looks like this is enough to at
least make it work with older devs again. Won't look the same.
Make description in event dialog selectable.

TimeTable improvement: More modern style tabs (though hacky, still using
the deprecated Gallery widget).

Fix navdrawer strings.

Still no clue why callbacks aren't called.
Fix default view selection. Use strings instead of ints now.

EventDialog tweaks: Use color refs, and don't set scroll listener if we
don't need it (pre-21 API).

Oops, remove scrollTo which is from me trying to figure out why suddenly
EventDialog's scroller is down a little bit on opening.

HAH! http://stackoverflow.com/questions/23034522/scrollview-auto-scrolls-to-selectable-textview
helped. So it indeed was because I made the text selectable.

Luckily the solution can be even simpler than what's suggested there
(explicitly setting focusability to false, not modifying a different
field).

OK OK I give up. I like using built-in drawables but they're ugly. Adding
proper 1-colour icons for all action icons.
Allow rendering BlockSchedule starting on half-hour boundaries.

Giggity.setShadow() to avoid duplication of the API level check. Also,
maybe there's another way to do this with older OSes.
Colour update: Darker black for titles/etc.
Fix layout on tablets. May need a little more spacing.

Suppress nav drawer in derived classes like SearchActivity. Don't want to
show it there just like the option menu is omitted to avoid a very deep
activity history.

Widget update. Not the final state yet, but at least it fits the new colour
scheme.

menu.json can include some 'dynamic' navdrawer menu items pointing at, say,
the event website/maps/etc.
Ditch the FISL/'Verdi' parser which hasn't been used in ages.

Widget tweaks: Allow 2-line title, center it and allow resizing one cell
smaller than before. Still not super great but I think I'm happy for now.
Fix crash on items without description (who does that anyway?).

Comment-only commit of stuff I may just choose to finish later. Can't think
of a way to do this that would not be terrible. Also, Fetcher is charset-aware
which is not very helpful when loading PNG files. Meh.
Released 1.1 (earlier this week).

Use AlertManager.setExact() to keep old pre-API-19 precision.

It's not actually clear how much delay the old set() could give, but
reminders should be infrequent enough to justify setExact() I hope.

Appears to be compatible with 4.1 again. \o/

Takes the 'market share' from 60% to 90% I think. That's good enough.

Disable shadow on old phones. Can't find a good way to control it
programmatically after activity creation (setting theme after creation
does not change existing views), so let's just not have it at all.

Reminder/notification update: More compliant with new style. Using generic
icon that I'm not too happy about but at least it renders properly. Also,
mark it as non-private so you don't need to unlock to see some detail. Last,
cancel stale notifications when new ones come in.

Fix database-related crash in updateData(), many thanks to whoever reported
that ANR!
